page.title: 01A Description of the Area
page.content: The countryside is mainly green and quite peaceful.The fields look like green sheets.If you look outside in summer, they are as yellow as the sun.They are blowing in the wind, and the golden wheat is glorious.About 80% of the crops grown are wheat and barley,but there is grass for silage and hay. The roads are long and narrow, with wider parts so cars can pass.The rolling hills are not very big,and if you go over one in a car you will hardly notice it.Lilley Bottom is a long valley-like road with high hedgerows.Wild rabbits,hares and rats live here,and gaudy pheasants stand like statues.The woods are enchanting with many different shades of green.There are about three hundred houses in six villages dotted about this area, and dozens of small farms.
